data.text:
Kingdom of Berats ཨཱལ་བེརཙ་དི༷ཨས

Al-berats dixas Capital

(and largest city) Caspar Official languages Beratian Ethnic groups –95% Beratians

–5% others Demonym Beratian Government Unitary parliamentary constitutional monarchy Leaders –Prime Minister: Muhammed Abdula

–Monarch: Abdul XI Independence –Unification: 7 December 1319 Population 7,463,240 (2017 estimate) Currency Beratian Lago

Berats (Beratian: བེརཙ; Berats), officially the Kingdom of Berats (Beratian: ཨཱལ་བེརཙ་དི༷ཨས; Al-berats dixas), is a country located in Northwestern Pravia. It has a population of 7,463,240. Its capital and largest city is Caspar.

Berats is a parliamentary constitutional monarchy, which was established following the unification of Beratian-speaking city-states on 7 December 1319. Berats is a unitary state, consisting of seventeen provinces, further subdivided into districts, further subdivided into elderships.

Indigenous people of Berats are known as Beratians. Beratians make up about 95% of the Beratian population. The remaining 5% is made up of immigrants from other nationalities, and also some Titovanians, Zornians, and Dresperlandics who reside on the border with their respective countries.

The sole official language of Berats is Beratian, a language isolate. Beratian is spoken natively by the majority of the population.
